description: Reserved matters application for access, layout, appearance, scale and landscaping in relation to the Phase 2A Basement (South of the Thames Sewer) within the Northern Site Development Zone of NCGM pursuant to planning permission reference 2014/2810 dated 121th February 2015.
site_name: Site Of Covent Garden Market Authority
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed [OTC-SQP-01-ZZ-DR-AR-023102-P02, OTC-SQP-ZZ-00-DR-AR-021160-P02, OTC-SQP-ZZ-00-DR-AR-021161-P02, OTC-SQP-ZZ-B1-DR-AR-021100-P02, OTC-SQP-ZZ-ZZ-DR-AR-023101-P02, OTC-SQP-ZZ-ZZ-SH-AR-025100-P02, OTC-SQP-ZZ-B1-DR-AR-021110; Statement of EIA Conformity to Support a Reserved Matters Application for the Phase 2A Basement (South of the Thames Sewer) of the Nine Elms Square Development (dated 17th November 2022) by AECOM; Buildings N1-5, Phase 2A Basement Transport Report (November 2022) by Caneparo Associates; Phase 2A Basement, Design and Access Statement, Reserved Matters Application (November 2022) by Squire & Partners; Operational Waste Management Plan (May 2023 Revision 3) by AECOM]. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.

Condition : 2 - Notwithstanding the details shown on the hereby approved plans, details of the long stay cycle parking spaces, seeking to increase the number of cycle parking spaces provided, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of development. The submitted details shall demonstrate that the level of cycle parking to be provided is in accordance with the requirements of London Plan Policy T5, unless it can be satisfactorily demonstrated otherwise. The cycle storage and routes to/from the stores shall be designed in accordance with the London Cycle Design Standards and seek to include provision of 5% of the total cycle spaces as accessible, single-tier standards. The details thereby approved shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter for use at all times without obstruction.

Reason: To ensure adequate provision is made for cycle parking and to promote sustainable modes of transport in accordance with London Plan Policy T5 and Local Plan Policy LP51.

Condition : 3 - INFORMATIVE: The footway and carriageway on the A3205 Nine Elms Lanes must not be blocked during the related construction works of the development. Temporary obstructions during the development must be kept to a minimum and should not encroach on the clear space needed to provide safe passage for pedestrians or obstruct the flow of traffic on the A3205 Nine Elms Lanes.
Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE: All vehicles associated with the development of the must only park/ stop at permitted locations and within the time periods permitted by existing on-street restrictions.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: No skips or construction materials shall be kept on the footway or carriageway on the TLRN at any time. Should the applicant wish to install scaffolding or a hoarding on the footway whilst undertaking this work, separate licences may be required with TfL, please see, https://www.tfl.gov.uk/info-for/urban-planning-and-construction/highway-licences.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: You are advised that the development should be undertaken in accordance with the Written Scheme of Investigation for Archaeological Watching Brief (Wessex Archaeology April 2018 (Document Ref: 202060.01)).

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE: You are requested to enter into early discussions with Historic England and other interested parties and to fully explore opportunities to reflect the Battersea Channel interest in later Reserved Matters applications, including landscaping and surface treatment details and the development of the Cultural Strategy and Action Plan for the Northern Site.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE: You are advised that further submissions under Conditions 52, 57, 58 and 87 are required in order to ensure consistency between the approved basement design and details of cycle and car parking, including allocation of at least one regular car parking space and one accessible car parking space for the health centre (D1 use).

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE: This approval relates to the reserved matters for the 'Northern' basement of the Northern Development Zone Site only. Approval of all other reserved matters must be obtained from the local planning authority prior to the commencement of that related phase or part thereof in accordance with Condition 4 of planning permission 2014/2810.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE: You are requested to consult with the Council's Waste Strategy Manager in the development of a Sustainable Waste Strategy for each floorspace phase in accordance with Condition 62 of planning permission 2014/2810 to ensure proposals for waste collection and recycling are in accordance with the Council's guidance.
